job.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p>Lucas Group has partnered with a growing SaaS company on their search for a Remote Sr. Site Reliability Engineer. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and "nerding out" on technology, this is the company for you. Not to mention, you get to do it from your own home 100% of the time! <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><strong><u>Scope of Responsibilities</u></strong>:<br><br></p><ul><li>Building, and maintaining, robust, actionable alerting and monitoring systems and workflows. Influence across boundaries and at all levels of the organization.</li><li>Implement, maintain and improve CI/CD processes and tools.</li><li>Work closely with development teams to improve services, deployments and releases.</li><li>Build enhancements within an existing software architecture and suggest improvements to the architecture.</li><li>Assists in defining the appropriate operational planning. </li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p><strong><u>Skills Needed</u></strong>:<br><br></p><ul><li>A desire to automate everything. Whether that be infrastructure as code or tooling to eliminate toil, automation should be a core focus of your mindset and the elimination of repetitive tasks should be a constant desire in the role.</li><li>A mindset of total ownership - you aren't afraid to dig into things you've never worked on before, from the browser all the way to the persistence layer. You've got a solid foundation in debugging and can jump in when needed to any problem you're asked to help with.</li><li>An architectural mind. You understand the fundamentals of distributed computing and look for ways to make systems more resilient, self-healing, and eliminate the need for human intervention as much as possible. </li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p><strong><u>Educational &amp; Work Requirements</u></strong>:<br><br></p><ul><li><strong>Degree</strong>: B.S.
